intro: Buphthalmum sessile, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sunflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Buphthalmum sessile is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native gardens.
